author: Siobhan Hughes
title: Some Republicans See House Speaker Race as an Open Field
text:
WASHINGTON—In endorsing his top lieutenant as his successor, House Speaker Paul Ryan has sought to project an air of inevitability around Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy and lock in the California Republican’s status as the heir apparent.
It is a perception that could be hard to sustain.

Many members of the House Republican conference say the... RELATED VIDEO After announcing Wednesday that he will not seek re-election, House Speaker Paul Ryan explained how he came to the decision and fielded questions on whether his retirement could signal a grim outcome for the GOP in upcoming midterm elections.
